alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Barry; Calhoun; Clinton; Eaton; Gratiot; Ingham; Ionia; Jackson; Kalamazoo; Kent; Montcalm; Muskegon; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 21 at 3:53PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...Rain Could Be Heavy At Times Through Tuesday... Rain will be on the increase this evening and it could become locally heavy. The rain is expected to continue into Tuesday. At this time generally around a half inch of rain is forecast. However there is a potential for locally higher amounts. If the heavy rain persists over the same area for a couple of hours...we may start to see values exceeding an inch. If those amounts occur an increased risk for river flooding could exist. Water levels are already high...and the ground remains frozen in many places. The crest on the Grand is near Grand Rapids. Also there is still some snow on the ground. Also...there is still ice in places on the rivers which could lead to increased risk for ice jams. Water levels would remain high for the remainder of the week with any additional runoff. This outlook means that elevated water levels and potential impacts are possible, but not yet certain. Anyone living or recreating along the rivers in West Michigan should closely monitor the latest forecasts, including the possibility of flood watches, warnings, and advisories. This statement will be updated as necessary. The latest information is always available at www.weather. gov/GrandRapids
